list_definition.definition: to repair (a building, a painting, a piece of furniture etc) so that it looks as it used to or ought to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The church is going to be restored.

list_definition.definition: to bring back to a normal or healthy state

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The patient was soon restored to health.
The authorities are trying to restore law and order.
The police restored the stolen cars to their owners.

list_definition.definition: to bring or put (a person) back to a position, rank etc he once had

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was asked to resign, but was later restored to his former job as manager.

list_ex_of_english: The process of collective learning described in the previous section restored the legitimacy of democratic institutions.
